descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge sharing.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential candidates for promotion to experienced roles.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers through departures from the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by advancing experienced contributors.
A higher promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move into core roles.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by advancing new contributors.
Better explicit documentation accelerates learning, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship accelerates practical learning, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship prepares experienced contributors for core responsibilities, increasing their promotion rate.
